intro.name: Daniel Pipkin.
intro.main: Based in Raleigh, NC, I have a knack for developing beautiful applications and transforming complex challenges into innovative, user-centric solutions that enhance both functionality and usability.

body: A roommate's Arduino project sparked a career shift for me, leading from 11 years in fine dining to a software bootcamp in 2017, and I haven't looked back since. There's a saying in hospitality: 'The customer is always right.' Whether in hospitality or engineering, I've always thrived on feedback and criticism, striving to provide the best user experience (or user interface!) possible, no matter how busy things get.
Here are the main technologies I've been working with recently:

projects.title: The Many Faces Initiative
projects.description: Sanity.io CMS from scratch with Next.js for a non-profit providing a paid, ten-week, brewery internship to people of color in the brewing industry. (Solo)

projects.title: Cloaked
projects.description: Vue 3, Pinia, and homeade encryption utyilized to create a new desktop dashboard displaying credit card, phone, and email aliases (Team)

projects.title: The Green Chair Project
projects.description: Custom Wordpress themes and CMS integrations for a non-profit that provides furnishings for those in need in the raleigh area. (Team)

projects.title: Ping Identity Assessment
projects.description: Cross-currency assessment identifying security threats using JQuery and SASS. (Solo)
